intro: Myrcia amapensis, commonly known as Amapé myrtle, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Brazil. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like eucalyptus and guava. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruits are small, woody capsules that contain aromatic seeds. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome.
